title: IP Calculator – IPv4 Subnet, Network, Broadcast, Usable Hosts

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Let prefix be \( p \) (0–32). Subnet mask has \( p \) ones followed by \( 32-p \) zeros. Number of addresses: \( N = 2^{32-p} \) Usable hosts (for \( 0<p<31 \)): \( U = \max(0,\,N - 2) \) Network address: \( \text{net} = \text{IP} \,\&\, \text{mask} \) Broadcast: \( \text{bcast} = \text{net} \,|\, \lnot \text{mask} \) First host: \( \text{net} + 1 \) (if \( U>0 \)) Last host: \( \text{bcast} - 1 \) (if \( U>0 \))
